abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo digs in his heels against extending so-called millionaires' tax on high-earning New Yorkers, saying income tax surcharge would place New York at competitive disadvantage with neighboring states.
snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who campaigned on the promise that he would not raise taxes, said an income tax surcharge would place New York at a competitive disadvantage.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who campaigned on the promise that he would not raise taxes, said an income tax surcharge would place New York at a competitive disadvantage.

headline.main: Despite Protests, Cuomo Says He Will Not Extend a Tax Surcharge on Top Earners
headline.print_headline: Despite Protests, Cuomo Says He Will Not Extend a Tax Surcharge on Top Earners
headline.seo: Cuomo Says He Will Not Renew Millionaires’ Tax
